intro: Pimpinella humilis, commonly known as the lesser cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. It is a biennial or perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 60 cm. Its seeds are small and often dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
